intro: Cremanthodium ellisii, commonly known as the Ellis's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. This perennial herb is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
